Description: Nude female terracotta figure in frontal pose with right arm hanging straight at the side. The navel is a large hole; two shallow indentations just above buttocks at back. Head, left arm and breast and lower part of legs missing. Fairly fine, porous, light brown-orange clay, 5YR7/6, some small mica, surface burnished/slipped.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Unusual nude female form. Possibly an Astarte figure from the Levant.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.030) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5834 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
